alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 8:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morgan, northwestern Johnson and southern Elliott Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 832 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Isonville, or 7 miles southeast of Sandy Hook, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Isonville and Relief around 835 PM EDT. Moon around 845 PM EDT. Mima around 850 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Crockett, Silverhill, Jeptha, Dingus, Elkfork, Little Sandy, Steele, Elamton, Lenox, Lick Branch, Cottle, Wrigley, Florress and Matthew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
